cs3524.mud

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs3524.mud.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a player in an MUD world.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a player with a given name.
      Player(java.lang.String name, double maxCarryWeight)
      Creates a player with a given name and the ability to carry items of a total weight specified.
      Player(java.lang.String name, double maxCarryWeight, java.util.ArrayList<Item> equipment)
      Creates a player with a given name and the ability to carry items of a total weight specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a player with a given name. This player will not be able to pick up any items, since the value of maxCarryWeight is set to zero. This player will also have no items in the equipment.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new player

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              double maxCarryWeight)
        Creates a player with a given name and the ability to carry items of a total weight specified. This player will also have no items in the equipment.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new player
        maxCarryWeight - the total weight of items the player can carry

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              double maxCarryWeight,
              java.util.ArrayList<Item> equipment)
        Creates a player with a given name and the ability to carry items of a total weight specified. This player will be carrying items from the list provided.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new player
        maxCarryWeight - the total weight of items the player can carry
        equipment - the list of item the player will be equipped with

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two players. For this project, it was assumed, that a player is identified by their name, so no two players can have the same name (within one MUD). Therefore, if two players have exactly the same name, they are considered the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare to

      • take

        public void take(Item item)
        Makes the player pick an item up. Only an item from the player's current location can be picked up.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be picked up

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the player's name.

      • getCurrentLocation

        public Location getCurrentLocation()
        Returns the player's current location.

      • setCurrentLocation

        public void setCurrentLocation(Location l)
        Sets the player's current location to a specified one.
        Parameters:
        l - the new location

      • addToEquipment

        public void addToEquipment(Item i)
        Adds an item to player's equipment list.
        Parameters:
        i - the item to be added to the player's equipment

      • listEquipment

        public java.util.List<Item> listEquipment()
        Returns a list of items, currently carried by the player.
